abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Groundwater and
            Soil Conservation Project for Yemen are: to improve water
            use efficiency and increase farmers return to water through
            ad option of water saving technologies; and  increase
            surface and groundwater availability through rehabilitation
            of small to medium spate irrigation schemes, terrace
            rehabilitation, bank protection works and other water and
            soil conservation activities. The Implementation of the
            Groundwater and Soil Conservation Project (GSCP) had been
            carried out satisfactorily and its Implementation Status and
            Results (ISR) ratings for both the progress towards
            achieving Project Development Objectives (PDO) and
            Implementation Progress (IP) had been
            'satisfactory' until its IP rating was downgraded
            in June 2011 due to stoppage of most of the activities as a
            result of the current political and security environment in
            the country. A number of contracts (works and goods)
            amounting to US$6.6 million are put on hold now. Without
            completing these ongoing activities, the PDO may not be
            fully attained. The extension is thus necessary to complete
            the remaining contracts and attain the PDO. These contracts
            have already been awarded and are expected to be completed
            as soon as the current situation stabilizes.
